meanings.definition: Surrounding or besieging a place or person in order to force them to do something.
meanings.sent1: The gheraoing protesters stood firm outside the building.
meanings.sent2: The police used barriers to prevent gheraoing tactics.
meanings.sent3: The gheraoing crowd chanted slogans for hours.
meanings.sent4: The gheraoing clouds darkened the sky, signaling a storm.
meanings.sent5: The gheraoing walls of the castle kept intruders at bay.

meanings.definition: The act of encircling or surrounding someone or something in a protest or demonstration.
meanings.sent1: The gheraoing of the government office caused a stir.
meanings.sent2: The students organized a peaceful gheraoing around the campus.
meanings.sent3: The gheraoing of the statue was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The gheraoing of the park symbolized unity among the community.
meanings.sent5: The gheraoing of the suspect led to a peaceful resolution.
